intro: Ascogrammitis angustipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf chain fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, arching fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces sporangia in clusters along the margins of its fertile leaves, which are often covered in a distinctive, hairy structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Ascogrammitis angustipes is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in indoor settings.
